intro: Tridesmis formosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals, typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Tridesmis formosa is also known for its ability to spread rapidly, making it a common weed in many regions.
